author: Ayoola Olasupo
title: Abiodun rewards workers
text:
The Ogun State Government has rewarded some workers in the state civil service for their outstanding performances towards the growth of the state in 2023.
Governor Dapo Abiodun, who was represented by the Head of Service, Kolawole Fagbohum, said the rewards given to the individuals were meant to encourage effective and healthy competition among the state workforce to improve their performances for the continuous growth of the state.
Abiodun stated this during the end-of-the-year thanksgiving and award of excellence organised by the Ministry of Environment in collaboration with other agencies, including Ogun State Environmental Protection Agency, and Ogun State Waste Management Authority, at the Government House in Abeokuta.
The awardees who received certificates and cash prizes were Olabamiji Akorede from the Ministry of Environment, Mrs Esther Adeyanju from Ogun State Environmental Protection Agency and Ibrahim Yusuf from Ogun State Waste Management Authority.
A statement on Saturday read in part, “Governor Abiodun also used the opportunity to reiterate government determination to always prioritise workers welfare which can be attested to by the monthly palliative allowance to cushion the effects of removal of fuel subsidy and global economic meltdown, payment of peculiar allowances and the recently paid end-of-the-year special bonus to all categories of its workforce.
“These allowances he said were effected without any labour unrest in the state which confirmed that the present administration is worker-friendly, pledging to always encourage them to always be the best they can be in the service through in-service training, upgrading and promotions.”

author: Liz Shultz - Local BN
title: Polk County DOH Issues Health Advisory For Hurricane Milton Aftermath
text:
Polk County Continues Recovery After Hurricane Milton (PCSO) POLK COUNTY, Fla. – The Florida Department of Health in Polk County (DOH-Polk) is urging residents to prioritize their health and safety as they navigate the aftermath of Hurricane Milton.
The department emphasizes the importance of vigilance and preventative measures to avoid potential health risks associated with flooding, contaminated water, and other post-storm hazards.
Floodwater Precautions:
Floodwaters can carry contaminants that pose significant health risks. DOH-Polk stresses the importance of avoiding contact with floodwater whenever possible. If contact is unavoidable, thorough handwashing with soap and disinfected water is crucial, especially before handling food, after using the restroom, and after participating in cleanup activities.
READ: UF/IFAS Needs Your Help To Assess Hurricane Milton’s Impact On Florida Agriculture
Any open wounds exposed to floodwater should be cleaned immediately, and individuals should seek medical attention if signs of infection develop.
Vibrio vulnificus Awareness:
DOH-Polk warns residents about the risk of Vibrio vulnificus, a bacteria found in warm brackish water that can cause severe illness, particularly in individuals with weakened immune systems or open wounds. Symptoms such as diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain should be reported to a healthcare professional immediately, especially if they occur after potential exposure to floodwater.
Carbon Monoxide Safety:
The use of generators and other fuel-powered equipment indoors poses a serious risk of carbon monoxide poisoning. DOH-Polk reminds residents that these devices should only be operated outdoors in well-ventilated areas. Recognizing the symptoms of CO poisoning, such as headache, dizziness, and nausea, is critical. If CO poisoning is suspected, seek immediate medical attention.
READ: GasBuddy: A Must-Have App For Florida Drivers Battling Hurricane Milton Fuel Shortages
Mosquito Control:
Standing water left behind by the storm provides ideal breeding grounds for mosquitoes, increasing the risk of mosquito-borne illnesses. Residents are encouraged to eliminate any standing water on their property and take precautions to avoid mosquito bites, such as using repellent and wearing protective clothing.
Water Safety:
DOH-Polk advises residents to heed any boil water notices issued for their area. Water should be brought to a rolling boil for at least one minute before consumption or use in food preparation.
Wildlife and Animal Safety:
Displaced wildlife can pose a risk to residents in the aftermath of a hurricane. DOH-Polk recommends exercising caution around animals and seeking medical attention for any animal bites. All bites should also be reported to Polk County Animal Control.
Mold Prevention and Remediation:
Mold growth is a common concern after flooding. DOH-Polk provides guidance on proper mold cleanup and removal, emphasizing the importance of drying affected areas quickly and thoroughly. Individuals with respiratory conditions or compromised immune systems should avoid direct contact with mold.
DOH-Polk remains committed to supporting the community’s health and well-being throughout the recovery process. Residents are encouraged to stay informed and follow safety guidelines to protect themselves and their families.

author: Redação AWAY magazine
title: Castanheiros micorrizados: o caminho sustentável para a adaptação às alterações climáticas - AWAY magazine
text: Durante séculos, o castanheiro foi a espécie arbórea-frutícola mais importante do Norte de Portugal. Com o seu porte imponente e a sua grande longevidade, o castanheiro é uma espécie com interesse ecológico, económico e social. O seu fruto, a castanha, constituiu, até ao aparecimento do milho e da batata, a base da dieta alimentar das populações rurais. Contudo, com o êxodo rural, com a introdução de novas culturas e com o aparecimento de doenças que dizimaram inúmeros castanheiros, esta cultura sofreu um grande declínio. Porém, a cultura do castanheiro tem recuperado nos últimos anos, com a castanha a alcançar um lugar de destaque nos hábitos alimentares. Dos cerca de 30 mil hectares ocupados por esta cultura em 2000, a área de território nacional ocupada por castanheiros aumentou para cerca de 51 mil hectares em 2019, atingindo as cerca de 44 mil toneladas de castanhas produzidas nesse ano e tornando Portugal no sexto maior produtor mundial deste fruto. Porém, a produção nacional de castanha tem sofrido um declínio desde então, tendo sofrido, em 2022, um decréscimo de 39,9% face à campanha do ano anterior, sendo esta é a campanha de menor produtividade dos últimos 37 anos de acordo com dados publicados pelo Instituto Nacional de Estatística, o que faz com que Portugal seja o oitavo maior produtor mundial de castanha. Este decréscimo na produção verificou-se num ano extremamente quente e seco, com a seca das mais severas desde que existem registos sistemáticos e que colocou praticamente todo o território continental em seca severa e extrema nos meses de fevereiro, maio, junho, julho e agosto. Estas condições climáticas, aliadas a novas doenças como a podridão da castanha, que se estima que tenha provocado quebras na ordem dos 40 a 50% na campanha de 2023, são das principais preocupações do setor. Aplicar soluções que permitam mitigar o efeito das alterações climáticas, das pragas e das doenças, torna-se, por isso, essencial. Ecologicamente significativos, os fungos micorrízicos estabelecem associações com as raízes das plantas, desempenhando um papel vital nos ecossistemas agrícolas. Estes fungos favorecem a captação de água e nutrientes por parte da planta, além de protegerem o seu sistema radicular, melhorando, assim, a nutrição das plantas, o seu crescimento, potencial produtivo e uniformidade da produção. Além disso, estudos recentes demonstraram que a associação do castanheiro com estes fungos permite mitigar parte do efeito da seca e das elevadas temperaturas. Neste sentido, a associação das plantas com estas espécies fúngicas em viveiro torna-se essencial. A comercialização de castanheiros micorrizados irá promover o desenvolvimento saudável das plantas e conferir-lhes ferramentas para tolerarem as condições climáticas adversas. Esta é uma das estratégias para ultrapassar os desafios atuais, pois promover a biodiversidade e manter o equilíbrio natural dos ecossistemas pode e deve fazer parte da solução.

author: Bill Roggio, David Daoud, & Ahmad Sharawi
title: Generation Jihad | New strategy in Gaza, who dis
text:

author: MarketScreener
title: Boeing, lavoratori stabilimenti Usa in sciopero, 96% ha votato a favore - MarketScreener
text:
SEATTLE (Reuters) - I lavoratori Boeing degli stabilimenti della costa occidentale degli Stati Uniti hanno abbandonato il lavoro dopo che il 96% di loro ha votato a favore di uno sciopero, bloccando la produzione del jet più venduto dell'azienda, alle prese con ritardi cronici nella produzione e con un debito crescente.
Il primo sciopero dei lavoratori dal 2008 è iniziato solo poche settimane dopo l'arrivo del nuovo amministratore delegato Kelly Ortberg, chiamata ad agosto per ripristinare la fiducia nel gruppo dopo che a gennaio un pannello della porta si era staccato in volo da un jet 737 Max quasi nuovo.
Circa 30.000 membri dell'International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (Iam) che producono il 737 Max e altri jet Boeing nelle aree di Seattle e Portland hanno votato sul loro primo contratto completo in 16 anni, respingendo a grande maggioranza l'accordo e optando per lo sciopero.
"Si tratta di rispetto, di affrontare il passato e di lottare per il nostro futuro", ha detto Jon Holden, a capo dei negoziati per il più grande sindacato di Boeing, prima di annunciare il risultato del voto ieri sera.
(Tradotto da Luca Fratangelo, editing Sabina Suzzi)
Condividi © Reuters - 2024

author: eulaliadoan9909
title: Renew Your Climate: Expert Heat Pump Replacement
text:
The Importance of Heat Pump Efficiency
Efficiency is paramount when it comes to your home’s heat pump system. A highly efficient heat pump not only reduces energy consumption but also lowers utility bills while minimizing your carbon footprint. Modern heat pumps are designed to operate efficiently across a wide range of temperatures, providing consistent heating and cooling without excessive energy usage. Higher efficiency models often feature advanced technology such as variable-speed compressors and smart thermostats, further optimizing performance and comfort.
Investing in a high-efficiency heat pump is a proactive step towards sustainable living. It not only enhances indoor comfort throughout the year but also contributes to environmental conservation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions associated with energy production. By choosing an energy-efficient heat pump, homeowners can enjoy long-term savings on energy costs while supporting eco-friendly practices that benefit both their household and the planet.
Signs It’s Time for a Heat Pump Replacement
Knowing when to replace your heat pump can prevent sudden breakdowns and ensure continued comfort in your home. Common signs that indicate it’s time for a replacement include frequent repairs, rising energy bills despite regular maintenance, uneven heating or cooling, and unusual noises from the unit. As heat pumps age, their efficiency naturally declines, leading to increased energy consumption and decreased reliability.
Another key indicator is the age of your current heat pump. Typically, heat pumps have a lifespan of 10-15 years with proper maintenance. If your unit is nearing or past this timeframe, upgrading to a newer, more efficient model can offer significant benefits in terms of performance and energy savings. Consulting with a qualified HVAC professional can help assess your current system’s condition and recommend the best replacement options tailored to your home’s heating and cooling needs.
Benefits of Upgrading to a New Heat Pump System
Upgrading to a new heat pump system offers numerous advantages beyond just improved heating and cooling efficiency. Modern heat pumps are designed with advanced technology that significantly enhances energy efficiency, translating into lower utility bills and reduced carbon footprint. These systems often feature higher SEER (Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio) ratings and advanced variable-speed compressors, ensuring more precise temperature control and quieter operation. Moreover, newer models are equipped with smart thermostat compatibility, allowing for convenient remote access and better management of indoor climate settings.
In addition to efficiency gains, upgrading your heat pump system can also mean fewer repair costs and increased reliability. Newer units are less prone to breakdowns and typically come with longer warranty periods, providing peace of mind and financial savings over the long term.
Choosing the Right Size and Type of Heat Pump
Selecting the correct size and type of heat pump is crucial for ensuring optimal performance and efficiency in your home. The size of a heat pump is determined by factors such as the square footage of your living space, local climate conditions, and the layout of your home. Oversized units may cycle on and off frequently, leading to energy inefficiency and premature wear, while undersized units struggle to adequately heat or cool factory inchttps://www.superpages.com/broadlands-va/air-conditioning-service-repair your home, resulting in discomfort.
Additionally, choosing between air-source, ground-source, or ductless mini-split heat pumps depends on your specific needs and property constraints. Ground-source (geothermal) systems, for example, are highly efficient but require adequate space for installation, while ductless mini-splits offer flexibility for room-by-room temperature control without the need for ductwork.
Energy Efficiency Ratings: What You Need to Know
Understanding energy efficiency ratings is crucial when considering a heat pump replacement. Heat pumps are rated by SEER (Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio) for cooling efficiency and HSPF (Heating Seasonal Performance Factor) for heating efficiency. Higher SEER and HSPF ratings indicate better efficiency, translating to lower energy consumption and reduced utility bills over time. When selecting a new heat pump, look for models with high SEER and HSPF ratings, as they often offer better long-term savings despite potentially higher upfront costs.
Additionally, consider ENERGY STAR® certified models, which meet strict energy efficiency guidelines set by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). These units not only save on energy costs but also contribute to environmental sustainability by reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Understanding these ratings empowers homeowners to make informed decisions that align with their budget and sustainability goals.
Cost Considerations for Heat Pump Replacement
The cost of heat pump replacement varies based on several factors, including the size and type of heat pump, installation requirements, and any additional upgrades needed. Generally, higher efficiency models with advanced features will have a higher initial cost but may offer greater savings in the long run through reduced energy bills. It’s essential to budget not only for the purchase price but also for installation by qualified professionals, which ensures optimal performance and warranty compliance.
Moreover, explore available rebates, incentives, and financing options that could offset initial costs and make upgrading more affordable. While investing in a new heat pump requires upfront financial planning, the potential savings in energy costs and improved comfort can make it a worthwhile investment for your home’s efficiency and value over time.
Professional Installation: Why It Matters
Choosing a professional installation for your new heat pump is crucial for several reasons. First and foremost, professionals have the expertise and experience to ensure that your heat pump is installed correctly and efficiently. Proper installation not only maximizes the performance and lifespan of your unit but also helps prevent potential issues that could arise from improper setup.
Moreover, professional installers are familiar with local building codes and regulations, ensuring compliance and safety throughout the installation process. By investing in professional installation, you can have peace of mind knowing that your heat pump will operate at its best from day one, providing reliable comfort and energy efficiency for years to come.
Maintenance Tips to Extend Your Heat Pump’s Lifespan
Regular maintenance is key to extending the lifespan of your heat pump and maximizing its efficiency. Start by regularly cleaning or replacing air filters to ensure proper airflow and reduce strain on the system. Keep the outdoor unit free of debris and vegetation to maintain adequate airflow and prevent obstruction of the coil. Schedule annual professional maintenance to inspect and tune up your heat pump, checking refrigerant levels, lubricating moving parts, and verifying electrical connections.
Monitoring thermostat settings and scheduling regular inspections can also help identify potential issues early on, preventing costly repairs down the road. By following these maintenance tips, you can ensure your heat pump operates efficiently and reliably throughout its lifespan, keeping your home comfortable year-round.
Comparing Heat Pump Brands and Models
When selecting a new heat pump, understanding the variety of brands and models available can greatly impact your decision. Each brand offers unique features and specifications that cater to different needs and budgets. Some brands prioritize energy efficiency with advanced technologies like variable-speed compressors and smart controls, while others focus on affordability without compromising on quality.
It’s essential to compare factors such as SEER (Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio) ratings, warranty coverage, noise levels, and customer reviews to determine which heat pump best suits your home’s requirements. Consulting with HVAC professionals can provide valuable insights into the performance and reliability of various brands, ensuring you make an informed choice that maximizes comfort and energy savings for years to come.
Environmental Benefits of Upgrading Your Heat Pump
Upgrading to a modern heat pump not only enhances comfort and efficiency but also contributes positively to the environment. Newer models are designed to operate more efficiently, reducing energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions compared to older systems. By choosing a high-efficiency heat pump, you can significantly lower your carbon footprint while enjoying lower utility bills.
Additionally, some heat pumps use eco-friendly refrigerants that have lower global warming potential (GWP), further minimizing environmental impact.
How Heat Pump Replacement Improves Indoor Comfort
Upgrading your heat pump system can significantly enhance indoor comfort by ensuring more consistent and efficient heating and cooling throughout your home. Older heat pumps may struggle to maintain desired temperatures or distribute air evenly, leading to hot and cold spots. A new heat pump with advanced technology can provide better temperature control, quieter operation, and improved humidity regulation, creating a more comfortable living environment year-round.
Additionally, modern heat pumps often come with features like variable-speed motors and smart thermostats, allowing for precise adjustments and customizable settings that cater to your comfort preferences.
Planning Your Heat Pump Replacement Project
Planning your heat pump replacement involves several crucial steps to ensure a successful upgrade. Begin by assessing your current system’s performance and consulting with HVAC professionals to determine the right size and type of heat pump for your home’s needs. Consider factors such as energy efficiency ratings, installation costs, and potential rebates or incentives for upgrading to a more efficient model.
Schedule the installation during a time that minimally disrupts your household routine and allows for thorough preparation and installation by qualified technicians. Lastly, plan for regular maintenance to optimize your new heat pump’s performance and extend its lifespan, ensuring continued comfort and energy savings for years to come.

With enhanced efficiency and superior comfort, you’ll enjoy consistent temperature regulation and reduced energy costs year-round. author: Shubham Tigga
title: Savitribai Phule Pune University promises students to address UGC’s term limit norm, PRN row
text:
Savitribai Phule Pune University promises students to address UGC’s term limit norm, PRN row
Mahesh Kakde, SPPU’s director of examinations the UGC’s rigid stance on term limit rule limits their intervention into blocking of PRN.
Shubham TiggaPune | December 5, 2024 17:23 IST
The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) administration has informed its law and engineering students whose Permanent Registration Numbers (PRNs) were blocked due to the University Grants Commission’s (UGC) term limit rule that it will attempt to resolve their issues within 15 days.
The assurance was reportedly given in writing, with the administration emphasizing that the final decision lies with the UGC. But the university has said that it would also take the initiative to address the grievances.
The development follows a sit-in protest staged by a group of students last month, demanding the unblocking of their PRNs to enable them to complete their final-year examinations. The protest, which lasted 12 hours, drew attention to the plight of students who exceeded the maximum term limit of N+2+1 years, as prescribed by the UGC.
The protesting students argued that they were unaware of the term validity rule when they re-enrolled after personal and financial setbacks. University officials maintained that the rule was implemented following a 2015 UGC notification and reiterated their inability to override the regulation.
Mahesh Kakde, SPPU’s director of examinations, stated that while the university has supported thousands of students with backlogs, the UGC’s rigid stance on this matter limits their intervention.
One engineering student, who enrolled in 2017 but had to discontinue studies for financial reasons after one year, mentioned that many students who took admission in 2017-18 and later discontinued due to various reasons were not informed about the PRN blocking rule when they rejoined college.
“There are students who enrolled in 2013 and for the next ten years till 2023, their terms continued without blocking their PRN ID. However, such decisions have not only caused mental harassment for students but will also place an additional financial burden on their families,” he said.
“After receiving their written assurance on November 29, we called off our protest, which had resumed on November 25 after the model code of conduct ended,” he added.
In response, Kakde stated that there is no assurance to resolve the issue, as it is beyond the university’s authority. “Only the UGC can take action on this, and we can’t. We can’t do anything that is beyond our control. However, we have assured them in writing that we will try our best to get it done. That’s it,” Kakde said.
The written assurance has provided some hope to the affected students, though they continue to await a conclusive resolution from the UGC.
